result.execSummary:
The defendant Montana Stevenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Payable to LIncoln County Sheriff's Office for camera and cellular antenna taken

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Counseling as recommended by Agent.
Letter of apology to victims D.J. and Lincoln County Sheriff's Department (to be approved by agent)
Supervision fees as deemed appropriate by Agent

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Montana Stevenson in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire provided to court - Statements by Dunphy as to plea agreement - Plea no contest to count 1 - Court 2 DRI - Waiver of rights and tendering plea - Waiver free and voluntary - Factual basis exists for plea - Found guilty by court - Statements by Detective Kingsley from Lincoln County Sheriff's Office - Arguments by Dunphy/Grubofski/Defendant/Court to sentencing - Sentence withheld - 12 months probation - Counseling as recommended by Agent - Restitution $404.94 (camera and cellular antenna) Lincoln County Sheriff's Department, joint and several - CC/SC - Letter of apology to victims and Sheriff's Department to be preapproved the Agent - Post conviction rights given
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
